description: From Middle English *happenynge, *happnynge, equivalent to happen +‎ -ing.

adjectives.description: happening (comparative more happening, superlative most happening)

entries.meaning: (slang, of a place) Busy, lively; vibrant, dynamic; fashionable.
examples: “ […] San Francisco is not exactly the most happening place, you know.”

entries.meaning: (slang, of a person or product) Trendy, up-to-the-minute.
examples: Every show has its hottest, most happening trends. If I were to isolate just one for hardware and one for software, this year's hot hardware would be the 386 machines, and the happening software would be desktop publishing.

description: From Middle English happenyng, equivalent to happen +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: A spontaneous or improvised event, especially one that involves audience participation.
